abstract.text: Converts audio data supplied by a callback function, supporting non-interleaved and packetized formats.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The audio converter to use for format conversion.
A callback function that supplies audio data to convert. This callback is invoked repeatedly as the converter is ready for new input data.
Custom data for use by your application when receiving a callback invocation.
On input, the size of the output buffer (in the
parameter), expressed in number packets in the audio converter’s output format. On output, the number of packets of converted data that were written to the output buffer.
On output, the converted audio data.
On input, must point to a block of memory capable of holding the number of packet descriptions specified in the
parameter. (See
Audio Format Services Reference
for functions that let you determine whether an audio format uses packet descriptions). If not
on output and if the audio converter’s output format uses packet descriptions, then this parameter contains an array of packet descriptions.
A  result code.
Use this function for all audio data format conversions except for the special case of converting from one linear PCM format to another with no sample rate conversion.

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Converts audio data from one linear PCM format to another.
Converts audio data from one linear PCM format to another, where both use the same sample rate.
Converts audio data supplied by a callback function, supporting non-interleaved and packetized formats.
A reference to an audio converter object.
Convert audio formats to efficiently manage data and quality.
A structure that stores a variable-length array of audio buffers.
A value that describes a packet in a buffer of audio data.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
